column4: Anyone know how to get a NetoDragon 56k modem to work on Ubuntu
i think those are based on the lucent chipset
either way, that guide is your best bet :)
web accelerators just plain don't work under linux.  at least, none that i've found.
most of the time, you can just use the built-in ppp stuff in linux to make the connection.  you won't get the acceleration stuff, but it'll work.
i'm in much the same boat.  i live in the boonies, and i THOUGHT dialup was my only answer...
Well it is my only one. No one offers cable, dsl or ISDN here, nor satellite due to tree coverage
but... there are wireless carriers that use non LOS service now.  most have 15 mile radius.  i'm looking into it now myself
Also..it seems in order to dial into netscape i HAVE to use the program otherwise it will not authenticate
Only wireless provider is 5 miles and they have a 3 quare mile range which I'm out of
you're using netscape's dialup service?  they just use username/password.  nothing special
Well it won't authenticate without the program though. I have tried everything
give this page a check.  choose your state from the dropdown.  you'd be surprized by what's actually out there - http://www.onelasvegas.com/wireless/
i no longer use their service, found a much better local carrier.  *shrug*
I'm in VERY much the same boat lol
satellite is available to me... but the 3000ms ping times scare me :P
yes, up-front costs on satellite 'net access is VERY expensive
the web accellerator is just not gonna happen, sorry to say.
the client app won't run, period.  they don't make anything that'll run under *nix.  none of them do.  those things are geared toward the low-end user, and the low-end user runs windows.  :P
i recently (well, 2 months ago) switched to ubuntu, and haven't looked back.  sans accellerator and all :)
in a nut shell lol
very cool :)
tried that.  i guess I'll have to call 'em tomorrow :P
